abstract: In Spain, Google’s online video-sharing service, YouTube, is not legally obligated to screen television clips for potential copyright violations before posting them on the site.
snippet: In Spain, Google’s online video-sharing service, YouTube, is not legally obligated to screen television clips for potential copyright violations before posting them on the site.
lead_paragraph: A Spanish court on Thursday sided with Google in a dispute with the broadcaster Telecinco, saying Google’s online video-sharing service, YouTube, did not have to screen television clips for potential copyright violations before posting them on the site.

headline.main: YouTube Can’t Be Liable on Copyright, Spain Rules
headline.print_headline: YouTube Can’t Be Liable On Copyright, Spain Rules

abstract: On Friday, the business page on Google News had aggregated nearly twice as many stories about Oliver Stone’s long-awaited new film – “Wall Street: Money Never Sleeps,” which opened on Friday – than about any item of actual business news. Reviews of the film were mixed.

lead_paragraph: Gordon Gekko is back. Whether that is entirely a good thing is open for debate – and there is no shortage of debate on the subject.

headline.main: ‘Wall Street’ Sequel: Buy, Sell or Hold?
